scripts.esp32:help:
node -e "console.log('
ðŸ” ESP32 Door Lock Commands:
  npm run esp32:setup     - Setup ESP32 database tables
  npm run esp32:test      - Run all ESP32 integration tests
  npm run esp32:test:tcp  - Test TCP connectivity
  npm run esp32:test:api  - Test REST API endpoints
  npm run esp32:test:network - Test network connectivity
  npm run esp32:test:system  - Check system requirements
  npm run esp32:test:webhook - Test ESP32 webhook endpoint

Windows-specific:
  npm run esp32:test:windows - Windows diagnostics

Documentation:
  ESP32_DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md     - Full deployment guide
  tools/WINDOWS_TESTING_GUIDE.md - Windows-specific guide
  tools/esp32_testing_guide.md   - Comprehensive testing
')"
scripts.windows:help:
node -e "console.log('
ðŸªŸ Windows-Specific Commands:
  npm run esp32:test:windows - Windows diagnostic info
  npm run esp32:test:system  - System requirements check
  npm run esp32:setup        - Auto-setup (Windows compatible)

ðŸ“š Windows Documentation:
  tools/WINDOWS_TESTING_GUIDE.md - Complete Windows guide
  ESP32_DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md      - Deployment with Windows sections

ðŸ’¡ Windows Tips:
  - Run PowerShell as Administrator for firewall setup
  - Ensure Windows Defender allows Node.js
  - Use better-sqlite3 if SQLite tools not installed
')"
scripts.service:help:
node -e "console.log('
ðŸ”§ Windows Service Management Commands:
  npm run service:install   - Install GMgmt as Windows Service
  npm run service:uninstall - Uninstall Windows Service
  npm run service:start     - Start the service
  npm run service:stop      - Stop the service
  npm run service:restart   - Restart the service
  npm run service:status    - Check service status
  npm run service:manage    - Interactive service manager

ðŸ“š Documentation:
  docs/windows-service-management.md - Complete service guide

ðŸ’¡ Requirements:
  - Windows operating system
  - Administrator privileges (for install/uninstall)
  - node-windows package installed
')"
